intro: Agalmyla sericea, commonly known as silky agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, silvery foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. Agalmyla sericea is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
